newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia sees 96 inflation below 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia sees 96 inflation below 10 pct.

text.p: Slovenia's annual inflation rate is expected to remain below 10 percent this year despite a possible electricity price hike, the government said on Wednesday.
Davor Valentincic, state secretary of trade, told a news conference that a phased increase in the electricity price was on the cards after general elections on Sunday.
"Electricity prices will probably be raised in two phases, by the end of the year, by 10 percent each time," he said.
"(Nevertheless) we do not expect annual inflation to exceed 10 percent," he continued.
Annual inflation accelerated to 9.7 percent in October from 9.4 percent in September. In December, 1995 it stood at 8.6 percent. -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
